mods:mods.mods:abstract: Jacob had for many years been low in John Jay's estimation. But he realized that his estimation did not accord with the divine dispensations to Jacob. All perfection in Deity and his acts reflect this perfection. Does everything because it is wise and fit and right that it should be done. Thus, none can doubt his acts without being culpable. We may and ought to examine acts to see if they be revealed and if we are convinced that they are we must accept them as absolutely right. Divine grace is guided by divine wisdom. We study the scriptures for this instruction. Men are free agents responsible for their own acts. They sinned and a redeemer promised. This was believed from Adam to Noah. Sacrifices instituted among the godly. Jacob was preferred over Esau because he esteemed the promises of God for redemption even though he used reprehensible means to secure them. Jacob's faith and not the works of either man was the important thing. Directly chastised for his wrong but the general course of his life was good. His life was hard and he was often deceived but his behavior was acceptable in the sight of God. On the other hand Esau had no faith in the promises but considered them visions. Jacob recounted all the past blessings of God to Esau (John Jay's own dialogue). Esau said he cared only for present well being not the future good of his descendents. Rebekah tells Jacob that it has been revealed to her that he is to have the birthright, and believes that it would mean more to Jacob than Esau since Jacob believes the promises. John Jay's dialogues continue for the whole story of Jacob's deception.
